content: mossy fairy castle in my ideal world everything would be dripping with moss we would all live in castles and we would drink tea all day out of fancy teacups as we watched fairies flying my mossy castles are inspired by moomin s wonderfully whimsical house and ancient scottish castles with their fairy filled grounds in order to keep it delightfully whimsical i decided to display my castle in a moss filled tea cup the castle is a quick easy knit it is knit in the round on dpns in 2 pieces and then sewn together embroidery is used for the windows and door copyright 2025 by natasha hanson all rights reserved 1 finished measurements 4 /10cm tall approximate yardage 4 yards/ 3 5 meters yarn the castle is knit with worsted main castle color and sock moss color held double or desired yarn i used patons classic wool worsted gray mix/grey or pink quartz/pale pink for my main castle color and fleece and harmony s point prim sock for my moss color caramel apple/lime of course yarn size and color are totally up to you thicker or thinner yarn will simply result in a bigger or smaller castle needles one set of double-pointed needles dpns in size us 2 2 75mm or desired size video links how to do a m1l &m1r how to do a french knot how to do satin stitch construction the tower and the roof are knit in the round on double-pointed needles separately and then sewn together the roof is knit from the bottom up the tower from the top down the windows are made with french knots the door with satin stitch the bottom remains open so that it stands better supplies small amount of stuffing toothpicks for helping castle stand in moss teacup or low dish and moss teacups can be found pretty cheaply in 2nd hand stores moss can be found in some craft stores try joanns or michaels if you are in america abbreviations k = knit k2tog = knit 2 together m1l = increase 1 stitch leaning left by picking up the strand between the needles with the left needle tip from the front and knitting into the back of the loop m1r = increase 1 stitch leaning right by picking up the bar between the stitches from the back with the left needle and knit into the front of the loop ssk = slip slip knit slip 2 stitches knit-wise one at a time to your right needle then return the now- turned stitches back to the left needle knit them both together through the back loop decreasing 1 st s = stitch es 2 mossy fairy castle instructions roof the roof is knit from the bottom up with your castle color s cast on 20 sts divide the sts onto 3 dpns as follows - needle 1 has 10 sts and needle 2 & 3 have 5 sts each join to work in the round round 1
